title: Arrest made in Jersey City teen's shooting death
content:
JERSEY CITY -- An 18-year-old has been charged with aggravated manslaughter in connection with the fatal shooting of a teen on Van Horne Street early Monday morning, officials said.
At about 1:30 a.m. police found Anthony Rios, 17, with a gunshot wound to his upper body and was pronounced dead at the scene, Hudson County Prosecutor Esther Suarez announced in a statement.
Rios' death was ruled a homicide, the 16th in Jersey City this year.
A short time later, 18-year-old Jacob Pommerehn was arrested in connection with the shooting and charged with aggravated manslaughter and two counts of unlawful possession of a firearm, Suarez said.
He is being held at Hudson County jail on a $250,000 cash or bond bail.
Monday morning, Rios' friends described him as being passionate about basketball and as someone who did not get involved in "the street life."
The fatal shooting was the second in Jersey City in less than 24 hours. Early Sunday morning, a 35-year-old man was fatally shot on Van Wagenen Avenue. Three other women were injured in the shooting.
Caitlin Mota may be reached at cmota@jjournal.com. Follow her on Twitter @caitlin_mota. Find The Jersey Journal on Facebook.
